thread.title: Rand Paul, still running for President, streams Iowa visit
thread.title_full: Rand Paul, still running for President, streams Iowa visit - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Rand Paul, still running for President, streams Iowa visit
text:
MIKE NELSON/EPA "I wouldn't be doing this dumb ass live-stream if I wasn't, so get over it," an annoyed Rand Paul told a caller who asked if he’s still running for President. Rand Paul wants voters to know he’s still running for President — and isn’t enjoying the dog-and-pony show of the campaign.
Paul is in the middle of live-streaming his three-day Iowa campaign swing on Periscope, a campaign gimmick aimed at jump-starting his sagging poll numbers. And the Kentucky senator seemingly grew irritated when he answered a question about whether he’s still in the race.
"I wouldn't be doing this dumb ass live-stream if I wasn't, so get over it," an annoyed Paul deadpanned in response.
Jessica Reilly/AP Paul greets attendees during a campaign stop at Loras College Tuesday in Iowa. Jessica Reilly/AP Paul is in the middle of live-streaming his three-day Iowa campaign swing on Periscope. Jessica Reilly/AP Paul signs an autograph for Jim Combs, a junior at Loras College. Previous Next Enlarge Paul also showed he might not be an expert on how Periscope works.
Answering the question of where he stands in the polls, he asked his staff “This isn't live — we can edit this, right?"
View Gallery 2016 presidential candidates Paul’s team argues that he was joking.
“Context is important, and Senator Paul was reading mean tweets and taking other questions when that question came up,” said Paul spokesman Sergio Gor. “Most media outlets realize he was being playful and trying to make a joke.”
Periscope is indeed live. And Paul has slipped to 3% in recent national polls, putting him in 9th place in the GOP field, according to Real Clear Politics.
